item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, April 21, 2025 at 8:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Blog hosted on a Nintendo Wii (171 points | 27 comments)
2. Show HN: Dia, an open-weights TTS model for generating realistic dialogue (185 points | 48 comments)
3. An update to our pricing (40 points | 15 comments)
4. Astronomers confirm the existence of a lone black hole (36 points | 31 comments)
5. Is 1 Prime, and Does It Matter? (14 points | 5 comments)
6. Launch HN: Magic Patterns (YC W23) – AI Design and Prototyping for Product Teams (86 points | 46 comments)
7. FTC takes action against Uber for deceptive billing and cancellation practices (158 points | 66 comments)
8. Adding keyword parameters to Tcl procs (34 points | 9 comments)
9. Pipelining might be my favorite programming language feature (184 points | 159 comments)
10. Optimizing Heap Allocations in Go: A Case Study (17 points | discuss)
11. Local LLM inference – impressive but too hard to work with (26 points | 18 comments)
12. A new form of verification on Bluesky (137 points | 94 comments)
13. Spark AI (YC W24) is hiring a full-stack engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
14. Dumb statistical models, always making people look bad (38 points | 3 comments)
15. How I use Kate editor (74 points | 10 comments)

19. Python's new t-strings (497 points | 362 comments)

21. Out of the Fog (114 points | 25 comments)
22. Tabular Programming: A New Paradigm for Expressive Computing (55 points | 14 comments)
23. AI assisted search-based research works now (60 points | 42 comments)
24. No Robot Like Robot (2018) (4 points | discuss)
25. Reworking 30 lines of Linux code could cut power use by up to 30 percent (218 points | 75 comments)
26. Show HN: Light like the Terminal – Meet GTK LLM Chat Front End (19 points | 9 comments)
27. LLM-powered tools amplify developer capabilities rather than replacing them (159 points | 112 comments)
28. Fossil fuels fall below 50% of US electricity for the first month on record (191 points | 181 comments)
29. Reverse engineering the obfuscated TikTok VM (356 points | 103 comments)
30. Haskelling My Python (124 points | 48 comments)
